meanings.definition: The act of moving on foot.
meanings.sent1: I enjoy walking in the park every morning.
meanings.sent2: She saw a group of people walking along the beach.
meanings.sent3: The walking of the ducks in a row was quite amusing to watch.
meanings.sent4: The walking of the shadows on the wall created a mesmerizing pattern.
meanings.sent5: The slow walking of the old man left a lasting impression on me.

meanings.definition: The gait of a human or animal, consisting of a series of steps taken with one foot in front of the other.
meanings.sent1: His walking was steady and confident as he approached.
meanings.sent2: The horse's walking was graceful as it trotted around the field.
meanings.sent3: The walking of the penguins at the zoo made everyone smile.
meanings.sent4: The walking of the dancers on stage was like poetry in motion.
meanings.sent5: The walking of the cat was so silent, it seemed almost magical.

meanings.definition: The action of taking a leisurely stroll.
meanings.sent1: Let's go for a walking after dinner to enjoy the fresh air.
meanings.sent2: They often go walking in the nearby woods on weekends.
meanings.sent3: The walking of the snails in the garden was a slow but steady journey.
meanings.sent4: The walking of the clouds across the sky painted a beautiful scene.
meanings.sent5: The walking of the waves on the shore was a calming sight.
